servinfo.title: Road Test
servinfo.ptxt: This test is to check if upshift, downshift and lock-up take place at specified speeds while actually driving vehicle on a level road.

item.ptxt: Carry out test in very little traffic area to prevent an accident.
Test requires 2 persons, a driver and a tester.

s1.ptxt: With engine running at idle, shift select “D”.
Accelerate vehicle speed by depressing accelerator pedal gradually.
While driving in “D” range, check if gear shift and lock-up occur properly as shown in Automatic Gear Shift Table .

servinfosub.title: Automatic Gear Shift Table
servinfosub.ptxt: Automatic gear shift schedule is shown in the following table. Test-drive the vehicle on a flat road in the D position.

table.title: 1. Shift point in D position and transfer shift position in 4H (motor-shift type 4WD model)

entry.ptxt: With applying brake pedal (coast down condition)

table.title: 2. TCC lock-up point in D and/or 3 position
3. TCC slip point in D and/or 3 position *1
1. Shift point in D position and transfer shift position in 4H (motor-shift type 4WD model)

entry.ptxt: With applying brake pedal (coast down condition)

table.title: 2. TCC lock-up point in D and/or 3 position
3. TCC slip point in D and/or 3 position *1
1. Shift point in D position and transfer shift position in 4H (motor-shift type 4WD model)

entry.ptxt: With applying brake pedal (coast down condition)

table.title: 2. TCC lock-up point in D and/or 3 position
3. TCC slip point in D and/or 3 position *1
1. Shift point in D position and transfer shift position in 4H (motor-shift type 4WD model)

entry.ptxt: With applying brake pedal (coast down condition)

table.title: 2. TCC lock-up point in D and/or 3 position
3. TCC slip point in D and/or 3 position *1

attention3.ptxt: The gear change is done at the shift point different from the above while any of the following control functions is working. Bear this in mind when performing inspection.

item.ptxt: When the TCM makes up-slope judgment, slope shift control (on up-slope) is executed by changing the gear change point to the high-speed side so as to reduce frequent up-shift and down-shift operations. When the TCM makes down-shift judgment, Slope Shift Control (on down-slope) is executed by changing the gear change point to the low-speed side so as to use engine-brake function effectively while driving on a down-slope.
Cruise shift control (if equipped with cruise control system)

cruise shift control is executed by selecting appropriate gear according to requirement for retaining a constant vehicle speed or acceleration so as to reduce frequent up-shift and down-shift operations while cruising.

condition.ptxt: Unable to run in all range
Unable to run in reverse position

ps.ptxt: Malfunction of input shaft speed sensor
Malfunction of output shaft speed sensor
Malfunction of transmission fluid temperature sensor
Malfunction of engine coolant temperature (ECT) sensor
